title: Deutsche Bank takes No.1 spots in Institutional Investor's All-Europe Analyst rankings
body:
Money managers have voted three Deutsche Bank analysts as No.1 in their respective fields. Kinner Lakhani (Banks), Spyros Mesomeris (Quantitative Research) and Andreas Neubauer (Germany) ranked No. 1 in Institutional Investor’s 33rd-annual All-Europe Research analyst rankings. The survey takes input from 2,200 managers representing over 800 institutions. Deutsche Bank ranked 3rd overall in the analyst rankings with 27 positions on the leader board.
Paul Reynolds, Deutsche Bank’s Head of Equity Research EMEA, said: “These awards are a strong endorsement of the work we do to highlight long-term investment opportunities for our clients. They also recognise the consistent investment we make in our research franchise and underscore the value we place on delivering high-quality, timely and thought-leading analysis.”
Kinner Lakhani is Head of Financials Research and joined Deutsche Bank in 2015. Spyros Mesomeris serves as Global Head of the Quantitative Strategy and the Quant Investment Solutions (QIS) Research group and has been with Deutsche Bank since 2009. Andreas Neubauer joined Deutsche Bank in 2001 and has been head of Equity Research Germany and Austria since 2008. In the team category the bank also achieved three No.1 placements with Timothy Jones & team – Chemicals, Warwick Okines & team and Richard Parkes, Timothy Race & team – Biotechnology.
